title: Next-Gen Professional Cleaning Calls for Sustainable, Easy-to-Use Products - Happi
summary: The cleaning industry is evolving towards more sustainable and innovative solutions, driven by factors like consumer demand, labor shortages, and environmental regulations. Companies like CloroxPro, Ecolab, and Tork are developing new products and processes that are eco-friendly, efficient, and effective in combating germs. These advancements include disinfectant cleaners with plant-based ingredients, smart dispensers with real-time data for optimized cleaning schedules, and sustainable packaging made from recycled materials.

title: YKK’s New DynaPel™ Water-Repellant Zipper Wins Best Product In ISPO Textrends Competition - Textile World Magazine
summary: YKK's DynaPel™ water-repellent zipper, featuring EMPEL® technology, won the Best Product in Accessories category at the ISPO Textrends competition. This zipper is designed to be compatible with garment recycling systems, addressing a significant challenge in the textile industry by eliminating the polyurethane film that hinders recycling. The DynaPel™ zipper achieves water repellency without compromising durability and offers a more sustainable option for performance apparel.

title: Oleochemicals Market Size Estimated to Reach USD 46.26 Billion by 2032 - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global oleochemicals market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 7.4% from 2023 to 2032, driven by rising demand for bio-based products, increased government initiatives, and growing consumer awareness. Asia Pacific is projected to lead the market due to its expanding soap, drug, and personal care sectors. Key factors driving market growth include the increasing demand for green and bio-based products and the growing transition towards green chemistry.

title: “Wool-based products improve crop production” - hortidaily.com
summary: Veratin has launched two new sustainable products for its Verigrow range: a biodegradable pot made from upcycled wool and a fertilizer supplement containing amino acids extracted from wool waste. These innovations are designed to reduce reliance on conventional fertilizers and plastic, promoting environmental sustainability and aligning with Veratin's commitment to circular economy principles.

title: Big Freedia’s Black Opal Collaboration Is All About Bounce - Essence
summary: Big Freedia, a New Orleans bounce artist, has collaborated with Black Opal to launch her first makeup line, Bold Beats. The line draws inspiration from bounce music and culture, with products named after iconic beats and moves. Freedia's passion for bold, saturated colors is reflected in the collection, which includes eyeshadow palettes, nail polish, and eyelashes.
